content: mittens for mimi these are a traditional type of norwegian mitten called selbuvotter i saw someone on a bus wearing mittens with a pattern like this so i recreated it to the best of my memory yarn 2 skeins 1 of each color østlandsgarn key dk weight 100% wool needles k = knit us size 3 / 3 25mm - child/teen p = purl us size 4 / 3 5mm - small mc = main color us size 6 / 4mm - medium cc = contrasting color m1a = make one away us size 7 / 4 5mm - large ssk = slip slip knit k2tog = knit 2 together dp = double-pointed needles cast on 44 stitches in mc k2 p2 for 20-25 rounds in whatever pattern you like shown 10 mc 2 cc 3 mc 2 cc 2 mc 2cc 6 mc you can k1 p1 if you prefer k one round in mc increasing 4 stitches equally spaced around the mitten to 48 stitches - all increases are done using m1a then start the pattern make increases for the thumb as shown to form the thumb gusset when you get to the double line in the pattern where the thumb will be knit in a piece of contrasting scrap yarn for those 11 stitches then go back to the beginning of this row of scrap yarn stitches and knit the next real row on top of the contrast row of extra stitches see below to decrease the top of the mitten use ssk on the right side and k2tog on the left side to 4 stitches and pull tight finally weave in all finish the top of the mitten pull the end of the loose ends yarn through the final 8 stitches and pull tight remember to reverse the pattern for the second when you are done with the body of the mitten mitten so you have one left and one right handed take out the scrap yarn and you will have 11 mitten both patterns included wet block to live stitches on each side of the thumb hole even out the knitting pick them up and then pick up one extra stitch on each corner of the thumb for a total of 24 stitches then follow the pattern for the thumb again use ssk to decrease on the right side and k2tog on the left side to finish the top of the thumb pull the end of the yarn through the final
